intro: Calycadenia villosa, commonly known as the hairy calycadenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Calycadenia villosa is known for its pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer.
